resources.string: Explore the wonders of our solar system and beyond
Mercury is the smallest planet in our solar system and closest to the Sun. It has a thin atmosphere and its surface is covered with craters.
Venus is the second planet from the Sun and has a thick toxic atmosphere that traps heat, making it the hottest planet in our solar system.
Earth is our home planet and the only known planet to support life. It has one moon and is covered mostly with water.
Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and is known as the Red Planet because of its reddish appearance due to iron oxide on its surface.
Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system. It has 79 moons and a Great Red Spot which is a giant storm larger than Earth.
Saturn is known for its beautiful rings made of ice and rock. It has 82 moons and is the second largest planet.
Uranus rotates on its side and has a faint ring system. It is an ice giant with a cold atmosphere.
Neptune is the eighth and farthest planet from the Sun. It has strong winds and storms in its atmosphere.
The Sun is the star at the center of our solar system. It provides light and heat that makes life possible on Earth.
The Milky Way is our home galaxy, containing billions of stars, including our Sun. It is a barred spiral galaxy.
